title: Life after (Soft) Default. (arXiv:2306.00574v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: We analyze the impact of soft credit default (i.e. a delinquency of 90+ days) on individual trajectories. Using a proprietary dataset on about 2 million individuals for the years 2004 to 2020, we find that a soft default has substantial and long-lasting (i.e. up to ten years after the event) negative effects on credit score, total credit limit, home-ownership status, and income.

Title: Life after (Soft) Default. (arXiv:2306.00574v1 [econ.GN])
Abstract: We analyze the impact of soft credit default (i.e. a delinquency of 90+ days) on individual trajectories. Using a proprietary dataset on about 2 million individuals for the years 2004 to 2020, we find that a soft default has substantial and long-lasting (i.e. up to ten years after the event) negative effects on credit score, total credit limit, home-ownership status, and income.
translated_abstract: 我们分析了软违约（即逾期90天以上的情况）对个人轨迹的影响。使用一份约200万人的专有数据集，时间段为2004年到2020年，我们发现软违约对信用评分、信用额度总数、住房所有权状况和收入等方面都产生了重大且长期的（即事件发生后长达十年的）负面影响。
tldr: 该研究分析了软违约（逾期90天以上）对个人轨迹的影响。研究发现，软违约对信用评分、信用额度总数、住房所有权和收入方面产生了长期且重大的负面影响，该影响会持续十年左右。
en_tdlr: This study analyzes the impact of soft credit default (i.e. delinquency of 90+ days) on individual trajectories. The findings indicate that soft defaults have substantial and long-lasting negative effects on credit score, total credit limit, home-ownership status, and income, lasting up to ten years after the event.
